intro: Ajuga vulgaris proles candolleana, commonly known as the carpet bugle or lesser bugle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, spreading habit with dense foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ground cover in gardens and naturalized areas.
